body_html:
Two work-arounds:

  1. with #13495 , you don't need to run configure. Just run it once, and then pulling/switch branches will remember the old values
  2. Use expect script like https://github.com/yaroslavvb/stuff/blob/ab45a0463f12942aef4561799523a2f80e56d7de/configure_tf_cpu.sh to automatically answer the questions
body_text:

with #13495 , you don't need to run configure. Just run it once, and then pulling/switch branches will remember the old values
Use expect script like https://github.com/yaroslavvb/stuff/blob/ab45a0463f12942aef4561799523a2f80e56d7de/configure_tf_cpu.sh to automatically answer the questions
body:
Two work-arounds:
1. with https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/13495 , you don't need to run configure. Just run it once, and then pulling/switch branches will remember the old values
2. Use expect script like https://github.com/yaroslavvb/stuff/blob/ab45a0463f12942aef4561799523a2f80e56d7de/configure_tf_cpu.sh to automatically answer the questions
